result.execSummary:
The defendant Cedric McCarty Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Any other sentence; with Huber

miscConds.notes: Provide a DNA sample. Court ordered the defendant to pay all of the following by the end of supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment; All court costs, fees, and surcharges including DNA; All applicable fees of supervision.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
UPON SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF THE PROBATION COURT WILL ALLOW FOR EXPUNGEMENT.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no drugs.
- Random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cedric McCarty Jr

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 235 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence with Huber.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 2 YEARS probation.

  Conditions of Probation:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied if applicable. 

Upon successful completion of the probation Court will allow for expungement.

Filed:   
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Defendant Cedric McCarty in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Cedric McCarty in custody.  Katherine Seelow for Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  Court ordered charge amended to Possession with Intent to Deliver Controlled Substance THC (200 Grams or Less/4 Plants or Less), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes sections 941.41(1m)(h)1 and 939.50(3)(i), a Class I Felony.

Attorney Darryl Everett Smith in court, defendant Cedric McCarty not in court, in custody.  Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for plea hearing, however defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 14, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
At the request of the court, and without objection from the state or the defese, plea hearing is moved from 10/27/2016 to 10/20/2016 at 8:30am in Branch 22.

Attorney Darryl Everett Smith in court, defendant Cedric McCarty not in court, in custody.  Daniel Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for Plea/sentencing hearing, however defense requests more time, defendant has a pending case in another county.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed.

Attorney Darryl Everett Smith in court, defendant Cedric McCarty not in court, in custody.  Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Darryl Everett Smith in court, defendant Cedric McCarty not in court, in custody.  Laura Crivello appeared for Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests  ore time. Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Status conference scheduled for July 7, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Darryl Everett Smith in court, defendant Cedric McCarty not in court, in custody.  Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Status conference scheduled for May 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Attorney Darryl Everett Smith in court, defendant Cedric McCarty not in court, in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow for Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Return on bench warrant held. Bail hearing proceeded. Arguments by counsel.  Defense requests status date to investigate pending charges in another county.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Status conference scheduled for April 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Darryl Everett Smith in court.  Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for return on warrant, however Branch 22 is in jury trial, case adjourned.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Return on warrant scheduled for March 24, 2016 at 08:30 am.
According to the state, defendant is currently in custody in another jurisdiction.  Return on warrant scheduled in Branch 22 on 03/23/2016 at 1:30pm.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($500.00 signature bond) gj
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
Attorney Darryl Everett Smith in court.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin for Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.

Defendant Cedric McCarty in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Peter Hahn for Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Cedric McCarty in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Cedric McCarty in custody.  
James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
